item.title: A bill to amend title 31 of the United States Code to increase the public debt limit.
Establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2004 and setting forth appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2003 and 2005 through 2013.

latestAction.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

item.text: Became Public Law No: 108-24.
Became Public Law No: 108-24.
Signed by President.
Signed by President.
Presented to President.
Presented to President.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Passed Senate without amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 44. Record Vote Number: 202.
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Passed Senate without amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 44. Record Vote Number: 202.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent. (consideration: CR S7089-7110, S7110-7115)
Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 80.
Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.
Received in the Senate.

The Chair announced that pursuant to Rule XXVII, as a result of the adoption by the House and the Senate of the conference report on H. Con. Res. 95, H. J. Res. 51, increasing the statutory limit on the public debt, has been engrossed and is deemed to have passed the House on April 11, 2003.
On passage Deemed passed. (consideration: CR H3349)
Passed/agreed to in House: On passage Deemed passed.(consideration: CR H3349)
Introduced in House
Introduced in House
On 4/11/2003, pursuant to Rule XXVII, H.J.Res. 51 was deemed to have passed the House as a result of the adoption by the House and Senate of the H.Con.Res. 95 conference report.

summary.text: Amends Federal law to increase the statutory limit on the public debt.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced on April 11, 2003. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)

Amends Federal law to increase the statutory limit on the public debt from $6.4 trillion to $7.384 trillion.

(This measure has not been amended since it was passed by the House on April 11, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Amends Federal law to increase the statutory limit on the public debt from $6.4 trillion to $7.384 trillion.

(This measure has not been amended since it was passed by the House on April 11, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Amends Federal law to increase the statutory limit on the public debt from $6.4 trillion to $7.384 trillion.

bill.title: Increasing the statutory limit on the public debt.

item.title: Increasing the statutory limit on the public debt.
Increasing the statutory limit on the public debt.

amendment.purpose: To require a CBO report on any new debt created by a budget resolution upon the reporting of that budget resolution.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
